page.title: 06NETLEY MARSH CHURCH
page.content: Netley Marsh Church was built in 1854. The vicar is Rev. George Biggs. There are 10 people who sing in the Netley Marsh choir. There are two church yards outside the church. The first is as old as the church and the second was opened in 1940. There are 1000 people buried in the cemetery. Since the church has been there, there have been 10 vicars. There are 2 vicarages. The oldest one was built in the 1860s, the second one was built a lot later. The organ was made in 1871 in Bath. At the bottom of the church there is a chapel which was finished in 1934. The east window was replaced in 1954 after the bomb which shattered the window on 26th October 1942. The first baptism was on 29th October 1854 of Rebecca Hurst.
